HOPE THIS HELPS

Computer/HKey-Local_Machine\Software\Wow6432Node\LucasArts\Star Wars The Force Unleashed 2

Edit the language from "ru" to "en"

Worked for me to get the menus in English




GLOBES INSTRUCTIONS

IMPORTANT : obrigatory the register with the language , 32 and 64 bits
                          are in english by default but very easy to change the language
                          text inside the game : edit the reg correspondent to your bits
                          machine with a right mouse click on the reg file then select edit ,
                          finally at the last line of the reg in where is the "en" correspondent
                          to english change this 2 letters to the next ones in case of want to 
                          change the language :

                          FR - french PL - polish DE - german ES - spanish IT - italian RU - russian

@charledFOR A SIMPLE FIX FOR YOU 


http://www.6ybh-upload.com/5sj9w0k25qd8/s.w.u2_lang.changer.rar

Eurgh, as always, the comments section is confusing as f*ck.

Here's all you need to know (YOU DON'T NEED TO DOWNLOAD ANYTHING EXTRA!):
====================

1) Download FreeARC (http://www.freearc.org/Download.aspx)

2) Extract into any folder.

3) TO CHANGE TO ENGLISH:  Go into main folder and double-click "reg 32 bits.reg" for Windows 32-bit users or "reg 64 bits.reg" for Windows 64-bit users.

4) Goto subfolder "LevelPacks" and double-click "Globe Converter.exe".  The game will unpack several files.  It only takes a few minutes.

5) FINALLY, go back to main folder and double-click on "SWTFU2.exe" and the game will start.

DOES THIS RIP INCLUDE ALL THE VIDEOS?
============================

Sadly, this rip does not allow you to view the FMVs (globeplus did not rip the videos correctly).  But you can HEAR the audio of the FMVs in full English.  So if that's enough for you, then this rip is made for you.

Other than that, every thing else is in English (the stormtroopers and your main char all talk in English).  So globeplus did a great job in that category.

If you can't live without proper FMVs, wait for someone else to dump this game.

@axlund

Click on "Start" and type "regedit" in the search box.  Then delete the following key (and all of it's subfolders):

Computer/HKey-Local_Machine\Software\Wow6432Node\LucasArts

The full .iso will now install.

Also, as a side note, this RIP didn't function correctly on a 64-bit system either.  Maybe the FMVs only work if you set the language to german?

@ namlesss

Try Updating DirectX9

http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/en/details.aspx?FamilyID=2da43d38-db71-4c1b-bc6a-9b6652cd92a3&displaylang=en

Or Download The Full Package Here

http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/en/details.aspx?displaylang=en&FamilyID=3b170b25-abab-4bc3-ae91-50ceb6d8fa8d

When Finished Downloading, Create A Folder Name DirectX Now Execute The Downloaded File And When You Reach The Point Where It Ask Where To Extract To. Browse To The DirectX folder You Created. After Go To The Folder And Run The "DXSETUP" File . When Finished. Try Running The Game Again.

Software Needed To Get This Game Running Are

1/ DirectX9
2/ Microsoft .NET Framework 3.5

http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/en/details.aspx?FamilyID=d0e5dea7-ac26-4ad7-b68c-fe5076bba986&displaylang=en

3/ Microsoft Visual C Runtime

http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/en/details.aspx?FamilyID=9b2da534-3e03-4391-8a4d-074b9f2bc1bf&displaylang=en

@NAMELESS
another issues ati user have when updating thier ati driver for this game is the ati catalist A.I.
and there simple soulution for gettn SWTFU2 to work was disabling the catalist A.I.
through catalist control center.

Newer AMD and NVIDIA drivers have so many OpenGL Extensions that Quake 3 engine based games crash when probing the extensions at game launch. 

2 solutions:

Download these fixed binaries (are also nocd patched)
OR
If using the NVIDIA proprietary driver you can start the game prefixed with: __GL_ExtensionStringVersion=17700

Possible Solution #1: (by mdiokwe) 

For ATI video card users, go to the Catalyst Control Center and enable Application Control Settings for SMOOTHVISION: Anti-Aliasing and SMOOTHVISION: Anisotropic Filtering. This may fix your SWTFU2 graphics bug but may also result to unwanted crashes. If this happens, enable tripple buffering in the OpenGL settings.
